text: Michael James Gillespie (May 7, 1940 - July 29, 2020) was an American college baseball coach. He was the head coach at UC Irvine and head coach at USC from 1987 to 2006. He led USC to the 1998 College World Series championship. He was born in Los Angeles, California. Gillespie died on July 29, 2020, in Irvine, California from problems caused by lung disease and a stroke, aged 80.Longtime college baseball coach Mike Gillespie dies at 80 ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from lung disease Category:Deaths from stroke Category:College basketball coaches Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles
title: Mike Gillespie (baseball)
